blue_zones.text: Certain regions called 'Blue Zones' (Okinawa, Sardinia, Nicoya, Ikaria, Loma Linda) have 10x more centenarians than average. Common factors: plant-based diet, strong social connections, moderate physical activity, and life purpose.
blue_zones.title: Blue Zones: Living Beyond 100

circadian.text: Humans have a natural circadian rhythm slightly longer than 24 hours (about 24.2 hours). Without external time cues like sunlight, your sleep schedule would gradually drift later each day.
circadian.title: Your Body's 24.2-Hour Clock

telomeres.text: Each time your cells divide, protective caps called telomeres shorten. After about 50-70 divisions, cells can no longer replicate properly‚Äîa process known as the Hayflick limit, discovered in 1961.
telomeres.title: Cellular Aging & Telomeres

time_perception.link_text: Research: Time Perception Across The Lifespan
time_perception.text: As you get older, each year represents a smaller fraction of your total life experience. A year at age 50 is only 2% of your life, while at age 5, it was 20%‚Äîexplaining why childhood summers felt endless.
time_perception.title: Time Feels Faster As You Age

weeks_in_life.link_text: Read: Your Life in Weeks by Tim Urban
weeks_in_life.text: If you live to 80 years old, you'll experience approximately 4,160 weeks. This visualization helps make that abstract number tangible‚Äîeach square represents one week of your life.
weeks_in_life.title: 4,160 Weeks of Potential

info.description: Each square represents one week of your life. Hover over weeks to see details, click to add notes and moods.

modal.notes_placeholder: Add notes about this week of your life...
